data.caption:
‚ÄúIt is important for all of us to appreciate where we come from and how that history has really shaped us in ways that we might not understand unless we ask.‚Äù
- Sonia Sotomayor, Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States

Hispanic Heritage Month is observed from September 15th to October 15th and recognizes the varied stories, backgrounds, and contributions of the over 58 million people in the U.S. of Hispanic, Latino, and Latinx origins. We‚Äôre celebrating all Hispanic and Latin culture!

Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg (1933-2020)

Thank you.

You may have read an article or two about mindfulness and are curious to know more. Perhaps you would like to try meditation, but don‚Äôt know where to start. Or maybe you‚Äôve meditated in the past and need a refresher. 

Whatever your experience level, we invite you to join Nina Farber, Michael Connolly, and Filippa Marullo Anzalone for presentations on the science and benefits of mindfulness, as well as a guided meditation and discussion. 

All are welcome!

Connect with us at 3pm TODAY through the Zoom link: https://bccte.zoom.us/j/91616810031

Do you know what‚Äôs so special about September 17th? It‚Äôs Constitution Day AND Citizenship Day! 

On this day in 1787, the U.S. Constitution was signed by 39 Founding Fathers at the conclusion of the Constitutional Convention in Philadelphia. The holidays recognize the adoption of the Constitution and celebrate all citizens, whether U.S. born or naturalized. 

Keep swiping for some facts about our Constitution! üá∫üá∏

#Repost @bostoncollege 
„Éª„Éª„Éª
On this day, we reflect and remember the lives lost on 9/11, including the 22 Boston College alumni, who showed bravery, heroism, and strength in the face of unspeakable tragedy.

Known to many as the Man in the Red Bandanna, Welles Crowther '99 is one such example. Welles sacrificed his life to lead at least a dozen people to safety in the South Tower. We continue to pray for him, his family, and all of those affected by the 9/11 terrorist attacks. #NeverForget #RedBandanna #BostonCollege #bc360
Photo: Office of University Communications

Anyone else ready for the long weekend? FYI the library will be closed on SUNDAY and MONDAY. Don‚Äôt worry though, we‚Äôll be back open regular hours (8am-9pm) on Tuesday! Have a great weekend, everyone! ‚òÄÔ∏è

The weather‚Äôs still gorgeous on the Law campus! Did you know that you can enjoy the sunshine, get your readings done, and social distance with your friend responsibly all at the same time? You can if you check out the Law Library‚Äôs folding lawn chairs! Just come to the Information Desk and ask for one (or two, or three!). And each chair is sanitized after every use, so you don‚Äôt have to worry üòâ

Happy first day of classes, everyone! We‚Äôre so glad to open our doors after being shut for SO long. Welcome back, Eagles! ü¶Öüè´üìö 

Very special thanks to @helen.lacouture for her amazing photography and direction!!

Hello again, folks! There‚Äôs still more to know about the Law Library reopening. Hopefully this helps you feel a little more confident about coming back to campus. 

This is part 2 of 2. Don‚Äôt be afraid to bookmark these so you can come back to them later!

Worried about returning to the library with all the changes? Don‚Äôt be! We‚Äôve tried to lay out all the important updates so that you know exactly what to expect when you return to the library. 

This is part 1 of 2. Go ahead and bookmark these posts for easy reference later!

Keep an eye out for our new #rarebooks exhibit on women and the lawbook trade, inspired by the anniversary (today!) of the ratification of the #19thamendment, which gave some American women the right to vote. See the @rockthevote graphic for how long it took to extend those rights. #legalhistory #lawbooks #printers #womeninhistory

Have you missed the Law Library? So did we! We‚Äôre excited to welcome students back to the library as safely as possible on Monday, August 24th. 

FYI, our hours will look at little different this semester:
Mon-Thurs: 8am-9pm
Fri: 8am-6pm
Sat: 9am-5pm
Sun: 12pm-9pm

See you soon!

It‚Äôs back to the library for staff members! We can‚Äôt wait to dive into all the books, law reviews, journals, and filing that we‚Äôve missed the last few months! Oh and it‚Äôs time to prepare for a few changes too. We‚Äôll keep you updated on what you can expect when you return to the library here.
Physically distanced Rare Book Room video shoot for Professor Bilder‚Äôs American Legal History course! #rarebooks #legalhistory #wearamask #teamlibrary

We have the responsibility to direct attention to and amplify the voices of the oppressed and disenfranchised, especially those of the Black community. 

Since we can use our platform to speak to a broader BC audience, we‚Äôd like you to check out @blackatbostoncollege. 

If you‚Äôre a Black student, alum, or community member, this is YOUR space to contribute your experiences and be HEARD. Just dm their account to submit your stories anonymously. 

If you‚Äôre a non-Black community member, this is your chance to see what it‚Äôs like being in the 4% of the BC student population that is Black. We hope that you use it to educate yourself and speak out against harm to Black people. 

@blackatbostoncollege, you have the full support of the BC libraries

#LibrariesRespond

Another busy day in the Supreme Court! Chief Justice Roberts once again made the critical vote in this decision- whether Louisiana could require doctors to have admitting privileges at nearby hospitals. This is a fascinating case and its ramifications largely go against the country‚Äôs current trend towards more conservative policies on abortion.

To read the full opinion, go to supremecourt.gov, then navigate to the ‚ÄúOpinions‚Äù tab, and click ‚ÄúOpinions of the Court.‚Äù The case is no. 18-1323.

It‚Äôs officially summer! Have any extra time on your hands? There are few better ways to take advantage of summer than educating yourself through reading, and boy do we have recommendations for you. Check out this repost from @jane_mount with fantastic suggestions and an engaging graphic to match.

Check out this excellent repost from @blkfreedomdotorg covering Juneteenth‚Äôs history, efforts to make it a federal holiday, and the prolonged suffering of enslaved Black people for two years after the Emancipation Proclamation. 
We hope you use today as an opportunity to reflect on how America has gotten freedom so wrong, but also to renew your efforts to push forward to a world that is more free, more just, and more equal. Juneteenth is a holiday of hope, and we believe a better future is ahead. 
#blkfreedom

Another big decision came down from the Supreme Court today! The Supreme Court overruled the Trump administration‚Äôs efforts to end DACA and the program will remain in effect. After a prolonged battle in the lower courts, DACA recipients can at last start to live with less fear of deportation. 
To read the full opinion, go to supremecourt.gov, then navigate to the ‚ÄúOpinions‚Äù tab, and click ‚ÄúOpinions of the Court.‚Äù The case is Department of Homeland Security v. Regents of Univ. of Cal. no. 18-587.

Finally, some good news today! The US Supreme Court just issued a ruling on Bostock v. Clayton County, Georgia: that federal discrimination laws protect gay and transgender employees. We‚Äôre so glad the Supreme Court made this decision today, especially during Pride Month. Time to celebrate!

To read the opinion, go to supremecourt.gov, then navigate to the ‚ÄúOpinions‚Äù tab, and click ‚ÄúOpinions of the Court.‚Äù The case is no. 17-1618.

Trying to think of more ways to support the Black community? Have you thought about doing that through your love of books? Order a new book through these Black-owned businesses!

Please note: many of these places are being flooded with requests for books right now. If they‚Äôre experiencing delays or no longer can accept orders, don‚Äôt forget about them! Bookmark this post so you can come back to them later.
#blackouttuesday #blackoutday2020 #solidarity

In this extraordinary moment in our history, it‚Äôs impossible not to feel sad, angry, or hopeless about the havoc the COVID-19 pandemic and the most recent manifestations of racial injustice have wreaked on our communities. Despite how tired we may feel, or how frightened we may be of misstepping, now is the best time to begin moving forward to a better future. If you‚Äôre wondering what you can do to fight racism and injustice, we‚Äôve got a short list of ideas to start. For more information about these ideas and for links to more resources, please check out our blog post at https://tinyurl.com/y8pgnjbq

#solidarity

BIG CONGRATS to the BC Law School Class of 2020! Check out the faculty‚Äôs message to the graduating 3Ls at https://youtu.be/I4lsKUBSxT0

What an outstanding and resilient class, of whom we couldn‚Äôt be more proud. 
#bc2020 #evertoexcel #bclaw

May is Mental Health Awareness Month and, especially now, we think it‚Äôs important to acknowledge just how hard these days can be.

That said, we want to let you know that we‚Äôre still here for you. Whether you have a research question, need help finding a reading, or have a tech issue, we want to help you. 
For research help: lawref@bc.edu
For help getting a reading: lawcirc@bc.edu
For tech help: atrinbox@bc.edu

Maybe you don‚Äôt need any law-related help today, but you still deserve a chance to chill out and take a minute for yourself. As a student you have access to hundreds of book and screen titles at bc.overdrive.com or movies.bc.edu. It‚Äôs ok to take a break and relax.

Finally, it‚Äôs normal to feel overwhelmed by what‚Äôs happening in the world or maybe in your own life too. BC is still offering counseling services, which you can absolutely take advantage of. For an appointment, call 617-552-3310 during business hours or 617-552-3225 outside of business hours and ask to speak with the Psychological Emergency Clinician. 
We hope any of these services can help you in some small way. Please take care of yourselves and remember that you are not alone.

#mentalhealthawareness #mentalhealthawarenessmonth #mentalhealthmatters #youarenotalone

we're finishing up our #lawlibrarypets series with two special guests: Pudd is a quiet coworker who's slowed down a bit in her old age. ü¶é Flyer, on the other hand, is a chatty youngster who can barely sit still! üê¶ they both hope everyone is holding in there as we approach the end of exams!

Curious about what Tupac, Marilyn, MLK, Katharine Hepburn, or David Bowie had in their libraries? Check out their Legacy Libraries and many more on #librarything, where we‚Äôve added Robert Morris‚Äôs library, held by BC‚Äôs own @bcburnslibrary! 
URL: librarything.com/legacylibraries

Images are either in the public domain, from the Library of Congress or National Archives with no restrictions, or used under a Creative Commons license: https://Creative Commons.org/licenses/by-bc-as/2.0/. Images of Tupac Shakur, Ernest Hemingway, David Bowie, and Julia Child attributed to Zennie Abraham, Il Tonnotto, Robert Sullivan, and Lynn Gilbert, respectively.
Cece is today's #lawlibrarypets star. while she's known to get grumpy if bored, Cece is generally content in her role as CNO (Chief Nap Officer) üí§

today's #lawlibrarypets is Teddy. he is somewhat indolent, particularly in the afternoon when he has trouble staying awake. he is also needy, always looking for treats. or maybe he is just hungry! either way, he's cheering you on through finals üê∂
#lawlibrarypets Jack (Maine Coon) and Oliver (Tuxedo) generally only show interest in lunchtime meetings, but they do want to wish everyone good luck on their finals!

take a break from studying to meet today's #lawlibrarypets star: Bao Bao! 
obedience and good behavior are not Bao Bao's strong points. so every morning, Bao Bao and his mom do an affirmation where they tell each other that they are going to be good and are going to have a good day. Bao Bao is definitely the office clown üê∂üòã
Looking for more resources to help you study? Let us assist you! Feel free to leave additional tips in the comments! ‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è

Run out of stuff to watch on Netflix? Us too! Or maybe you just need a break from studying for finals? Check out BC‚Äôs own streaming platform at movies.bc.edu for more movies and tv shows!

Pro tips: Make sure you‚Äôre on the BC VPN and using Chrome or Firefox as your browser!

today's starring #lawlibrarypets is Bubba, the Sultan of Swat! Bubba is a veteran of many wars. he is missing a big piece of his left ear and has many other battle scars. Bubba is a quiet, nondisruptive coworker üò∏

bonus fact: Bubba's theme song is Dire Straits' Sultans of Swing - https://youtu.be/8Pa9x9fZBtY

today's #lawlibrarypets profile: Ginger is generally a well behaved home officemate, although she is found asleep at her desk quite often. she's also a bit of a whiner when she wants to go out for fresh air at lunch üêïüåû

Happy #NationalLibraryWeek! We may not be able to welcome you into the library right now, but we‚Äôre still here to help, no matter where you are. Check out how we can support your studies virtually in these trying times!

this is Ferguson: the world's laziest coworker, who oftentimes can be found sleeping on the job üò∏

we'll be back next week with more #lawlibrarypets profiles!
Campus may be closed, but that hasn‚Äôt stopped the spring blossoms on Newton campus!

you may have seen Babo around the library in the past, but she is now on family leave, helping to stand guard over baby Olive while she sleeps on the couch. üêï

stay tuned for more #lawlibrarypets profiles!
Reference librarians are available via chat and email if you need help on papers, journal work, or other research projects!

meet Oliver: he's a particularly unmotivated coworker, unless the work involves sitting/lying/scratching/jumping in or on boxes. (it never does.) with everyone #workingfromhome right now we wanted to highlight some of our current four-legged coworkers! stay tuned for more #lawlibrarypets profiles soon üê∂üê±

Current BC Law Students: the COVID-19 Student Emergency Fund online application is now open. If you are experiencing an emergency situation that creates a temporary financial hardship due to the current pandemic, please visit https://tinyurl.com/vwharva to learn more and https://tinyurl.com/va6ya8s to access the application. Emergency funding will be provided in the form of a one-time grant that will not need to be repaid. We are especially grateful to the Boston College Law School community and the AccessLex Institute, both of whom made this fund possible.

Bored at home? We bring you social distancing bingo! Do you have five in a row?

Screenshot our template, mark the ones you‚Äôve done, and share to your story! Tag us and tag your friends to play too! We‚Äôve done pretttty much all of these. Let‚Äôs play! 
#socialdistancingbingo #bingo #socialdistancing #lawlibrary

Having trouble balancing all your due dates? What if you have a library book that‚Äôs due soon? What should you do with your books from ILL?
We get it, it‚Äôs confusing. So, to make your lives a little easier, we‚Äôve extended all due dates to August 1st for graduating 3Ls and September 1st for 1 & 2Ls. You‚Äôre juggling enough right now, let us take this off your plate!

Today getting you down? Looking for some help? We have good news for you! Our reference librarians are available M-F 9-5, Sat 1-5, and Sun 10-5 to answer all your law-related questions! Not sure how to contact them? It‚Äôs easy!

1. Navigate to the Law Library‚Äôs website, or https://www.bc.edu/bc-web/schools/law/sites/current-students/library.html

2. Hit the ‚ÄúChat with a librarian‚Äù icon and submit your question

3. OR, if live chat‚Äôs not your thing, just send an email to lawref@bc.edu and get a quick response!

Missing the Law Library‚Äôs course reserves? Trying to get your readings done ASAP but don‚Äôt have the textbook you need? We have great news! West Academic and Wolters Kluwer are offering students online access to their course books completely for free! Check out the following link for simple and easy instructions about how to set it up: https://lawguides.bc.edu/c.php?g=1011244&p=7325771

Yes, the Law Library is closed until further notice. Yes, we‚Äôre just as bummed about it as you are! The good news is that we‚Äôre all working to get you the tools and resources you need to be successful remotely. Stay tuned for more updates about how we‚Äôre doing that soon!
Law Library Director Filippa Anzalone and Marija Tesla matching in leopard on this wonderful Friday! üëØ #twinning
While the flowers might not be blooming yet, spring break is here! üíê  Please note that the Law Library will have shortened hours over spring break.  Check out the Law Library homepage for details!

March is just around the corner and the Law Library is celebrating by holding a March Madness tournament to determine the most popular book on course reserves! It‚Äôs easy! Fill out a bracket, vote, and you may win a prize! Now get in the game!

the #littlefreelibrary on the 4th floor is one of the BC Law Library's better kept secrets, but it has some awesome finds üìö

we encourage you to take a look - and if you find something cool while you're browsing, take a pic and tag us!

One of the best ways to celebrate Black History Month is to seek out Black Culture and History in your local area! Here are some great ways to celebrate around Boston. Check out our blog post at https://bit.ly/31LCOez for more info!

1. Walk the Black Heritage Trail

2. Visit the Museum of African American History

3. Become part of the Boston Black Restaurant Challenge

4. Check out Boston's Children Museum's month-long celebration of Black History Month

5. Visit the National Center of Afro-American Artists

6. Check out the Boston Public Library's annual "Black Is..." book list

7. See a performance featuring Black artists

If you have any other suggestions about great events in the Boston Area that celebrate Black History and Culture, please let us know in the comments!
A good day to hide indoors with a large coffee and an even larger casebook ‚òïÔ∏è Stop by the Law Library for your next cozy study session!
Join us today in the Law Library for the Spring into Practice Research Fair from 12-1:30pm.  See tools and demonstrations for 11 vendors and enjoy food and prizes!

Valentine‚Äôs Day is coming up! In need of a date? Stop by the new library display and check out one of our eligible items. Maybe you‚Äôll meet your match! #blinddatewithabook

Join us today for our first meditation sit from 12:30-1pm in the Contemplation Room (Room 427). Meditations will be held weekly starting today on Tuesdays from 12:30-1pm.  We hope to see you there!  #meditation #mindfulness

We hope everyone‚Äôs semester is off to a great start! If your still waiting on your books to come in, come check out course reserves! We‚Äòve got all required textbooks on reserve üìö

Busy organizing and outlining your notes as you prep for exams? Check out two examples from our #rarebooks collection: student notes from the Litchfield Law School in 1811 and an outline of Joseph Story‚Äôs treatise on equity, c. 1856. Check out Mary Ann Neary‚Äôs recent post on study aids and outlining in the BC Legal Eagle blog!
‚è∞ Starting today, the Law Library will have extended hours for exam period.  Detailed hours can be found on the Law Library's homepage.  Good luck with finals everyone!

Check out our Rare Book Room exhibit, ‚ÄúDictionaries and the Law,‚Äù which includes a 1st edition of Webster‚Äôs Dictionary, the iconic American dictionary first published in New York in 1828. The various editions of Webster‚Äôs have been cited hundreds of times by the US Supreme Court. #rarebooks #legalhistory #scotus #dictionary

Want to stay late (or come early!) to study at the Law Library?  The Lutch Learning Center is open for after hours study! Lutch is accessible from the outside corridor when the library is closed. Happy studying! üìö
The Law Library has shortened hours over the Thanksgiving break. We hope everyone has a wonderful break!! ü¶É #gobblegobble
did you know that cream cheese legally has to contain at least 33% milk fat? learn about that and more when you check out our latest library exhibit on the law of food! #foodlaw #cheesefacts

Come join us at 4:30 for Bryan A. Garner‚Äôs talk, ‚ÄúThe Gentle Art of Lexicography,‚Äù for the Legal History Roundtable. Reception to follow! #blackslawdictionary #bryanagarner #bclaw #legalhistoryroundtable
The nap pods are now full installed and ready for naps! Feeling tired? Head up to the 3rd floor to try one out!
Today is the day- the Law Library is getting 3 EnergyPods! All three pods will be located on the Level 3. #naptimeüò¥
The Law Library will open at 9am today in observance of Columbus Day.

One area of focus in the new #rarebooks exhibit is #blackslawdictionary, first published in 1891 and now in its 11th edition. Editor in chief Bryan A. Garner loaned us three books for the exhibit, including this 2nd edition that belonged to Charles Hamilton Houston, famed #naacp first special counsel and former dean of @howardlawschool, when he was at @harvardlaw in 1920. Come hear Garner speak in the Rare Book Room on 10/24 at 4:30, talk co-sponsored by the Law Library and the BC Law Legal History Roundtable.

Posted @withrepost ‚Ä¢ @bclawonline Today is #WorldMentalHealthDay. Last year, Impact blogger Erika Craven wrote one our most celebrated and well read posts, "A Necessary Look at Mental Health in Law School." Today, she is back to shine a spotlight on mental health and wellness and to share posts from the BC Law community on how they find joy and cope with stress. Take a moment to read her post, and please comment and share this important message with others--because we all need to support each other today and every day, on campus and beyond. https://bclawimpact.org #LawStudentWellness #iambclaw
Thank you to everyone who came out to play Supreme Court mini-golf with us today!! #scotus #minigolf #lawlibrary
Join us Monday 10/7 from 12-1:30 to play Supreme Court mini-golf in honor of the first day of SCOTUS‚Äôs 2019 term! #scotus #wehavecandy #minigolf

Did you know that the 1st English-language dictionary was a law dictionary? That James I ordered the second law dictionary to be burned? That Black‚Äôs Law Dictionary has been cited over 330 times by the U.S. Supreme Court? Visit the new Rare Book Room exhibit to learn about all of this and more! #legalhistory #rarebooks #blackslawdictionary

Yesterday we celebrated Father Fred Enman's countless contributions and to the Law School over the years.  While Father Fred will no longer be advising law students, he will still be active in the community, celebrating Mass at the Trinity Chapel.
